intro: Ixora samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan flame bush, is a flowering plant native to the island of Savai’i in Samoa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers, which are typically borne in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface with a slightly waxy texture. Ixora samoensis is well adapted to tropical climates and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil.
